edu.biu.scapi.circuits.garbledCircuit
Class AbstractGarbledBooleanCircuit

java.lang.Object
  edu.biu.scapi.circuits.garbledCircuit.AbstractGarbledBooleanCircuit
All Implemented Interfaces:
GarbledBooleanCircuit
Direct Known Subclasses:
FreeXORGarbledBooleanCircuit, MinimizeAESSetKeyGarbledBooleanCircuit, StandardGarbledBooleanCircuit
public abstract class AbstractGarbledBooleanCircuit
extends java.lang.Object
implements GarbledBooleanCircuit

The AbstractGarbledBooleanCircuit class is an abstract representation of a circuit. It contains all of the methods that are standard to all implementations and are not generally affected by optimizations.

Author:
Steven Goldfeder

compute

public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,GarbledWire> compute()
                                                     throws InputNotSetException,
                                                            java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                                                            javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException,
                                                            CiphertextTooLongException,
                                                            KeyNotSetException,
                                                            TweakNotSetException
Description copied from interface: GarbledBooleanCircuit
This method computes the circuit if input has been set. If input has not been set it throws an exception. It returns a Map containing the garbled output. This output can be translated via the GarbledBooleanCircuit.translate(Map) method.

Specified by:
compute in interface GarbledBooleanCircuit
Returns:
returns a Map that maps the label of the output wire to the garbled value of the wire
Throws:
InputNotSetException
java.security.InvalidKeyException
javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
CiphertextTooLongException
KeyNotSetException
TweakNotSetException

translate

public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,Wire> translate(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,GarbledWire> garbledOutput)
Description copied from interface: GarbledBooleanCircuit
Translates the garbled output obtained from the GarbledBooleanCircuit.compute() function into meaningful(i.e. 0-1) output.

Specified by:
translate in interface GarbledBooleanCircuit
Parameters:
garbledOutput - a Map) that containing the garbled output. This map maps the output wire labels to {@code GarbledWire}s
Returns:
a Map that maps the output wire labels to ungarbled Wires that are set to either 0 or 1.

verify

public boolean verify(BooleanCircuit ungarbledCircuit,
                      java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,javax.crypto.SecretKey[]> allInputWireValues)
               throws java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                      javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException,
                      CiphertextTooLongException,
                      KeyNotSetException,
                      TweakNotSetException
Description copied from interface: GarbledBooleanCircuit
The verify method is used in the case of malicious adversaries. Alice constructs n circuits and Bob can verify n-1 of them(of his choosing) to confirm that they are indeed garblings of the agreed upon non garbled circuit. In order to verify, Alice has to give Bob both garbled values for each of the input wires.

Specified by:
verify in interface GarbledBooleanCircuit
Parameters:
ungarbledCircuit - the circuit that this GarbledBooleanCircuit is supposed to be a garbling of. This is the circuit that Alice and Bob agreed upon in Yao's protocol. We are verifying that this GarbledBooleanCircuit is indeed a garbling of the agreed upon ungarbled circuit
allInputWireValues - a containing both garbled values for each input wire. For each input wire label, the map contains an array of two values. The value in the 0 position is the 0 encoding, and the value in the 1 position is the 1 encoding.
Returns:
true if this GarbledBooleanCircuit is a garbling of the ungarbledCircuit, false if it is not
Throws:
java.security.InvalidKeyException
javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
CiphertextTooLongException
KeyNotSetException
TweakNotSetException

setGarbledInputFromUngarbledFile

public void setGarbledInputFromUngarbledFile(java.io.File f,
                                             java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,javax.crypto.SecretKey[]> allInputWireValues)
                                      throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
Given a file containing the number of inputs and then the GarbledWire label followed by a 0 or a 1, this method will look up the garbled encoding of the 0 or 1 for that GarbledWire in the provided Map and set the inputs to the appropriate corresponding garbled values

Specified by:
setGarbledInputFromUngarbledFile in interface GarbledBooleanCircuit
Parameters:
f - the File containing the input values (not garbled--i.e. 0 or 1)
allWireValues - a Map that maps each input GarbledWire to an array containing its 0 and 1 SecretKey garbled values.
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException - throws this exception if the file is not found in the specified directory

setInputs

public void setInputs(java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,GarbledWire> presetInputWires)
Description copied from interface: GarbledBooleanCircuit
This method sets the input. It takes as a parameter a Map that maps the input Wire labels to a garbled wire containing the appropriate garbled value. See GarbledBooleanCircuit.setGarbledInputFromUngarbledFile(File, Map) for an alternate way of setting the input.

Specified by:
setInputs in interface GarbledBooleanCircuit
Parameters:
presetInputWires - a Map containing the input wires that have been preset with their values
